entry.title: Heavy Rain Warning - Orange
entry.summary: Expect 80 to 110 mm of rain in parts of the area on top of what has already fallen. Peaks rates of 25 to 40 mm/h likely in localised downpours, with thunderstorms also possible. Rain easing from the west Friday morning. Impact: Streams and rivers may rise rapidly. Surface flooding, slips, and difficult driving conditions possible. Chance of upgrading to a Red Warning: Low.

entry.title: Severe Thunderstorm Watch
entry.summary:
A moist unstable northwesterly flow is expected to bring frequent showers and possible thunderstorms to eastern Waikato near the Kaimai Range through until 7am today. There is a moderate risk of Severe Thunderstorms with downpours bringing localised rainfall rates of 25 to 40 mm/h.
Rainfall of this intensity can cause surface and/or flash flooding, especially about low-lying areas such as streams, rivers or narrow valleys, and may also lead to slips.

entry.title: Severe Thunderstorm Warning
entry.summary:
At 05:15 am, MetService weather radar detected severe thunderstorms near MATAMATA, TIRAU, WAHAROA, TE POI, OKOROIRE, HINUERA, ROTORUA, PYES PA, OROPI, NGONGOTAHA and OTANEWAINUKU.
These severe thunderstorms are moving towards the southeast, and are expected to lie near TIRAU, PUTARURU, THE MAMAKU PLATEAU, MAMAKU, OKOROIRE, LICHFIELD, TE WHETU, ROTORUA, ROTOEHU, ROTOITI, LAKE TARAWERA and OKERE FALLS at 05:45 am and near ROTORUA, WAIKITE VALLEY, WAIREKA, UPPER ATIAMURI, ATIAMURI, GUTHRIE, THE HILLS AND RANGES EAST OF TOKOROA, KAWERAU, MATAHINA and ROTOEHU at 06:15 am.
These thunderstorms are expected to be accompanied by very heavy rain and frequent lightning.
Impact:
Very heavy rain can cause surface and/or flash flooding about streams, gullies and urban areas, and make driving conditions extremely hazardous.
Frequent lightning is dangerous to people and livestock, especially those exposed outdoors or on the water, and can cause power surges and damage to electrical equipment.
